review_title: Good pay for NP but need better insurance
job_title: Mental Health Therapist in San Jose, CA
pros: Good wages for an NP organization
cons: Working out in the community requires lots of travel

job_title: Unlicensed Mental Health Clinician in San Jose, CA
pros: Great opportunity to serve the community
cons: problem with making an hourly position a salaried. I think it may be illegal to make such as low wage position salaried. Lots of overtime (unpaid because its salaried). Great if you love helping vulnerable populations!

review_title: Helping people is great, BUT combination of medi-cal documentation is not worth it.
job_title: Mental Health Specialist in San Jose, CA
pros: Flexible schedule depensing on department. Family culture. 40 hrs PTO for education, 32 hrs "mental health" days, 32 hrs sick pay' as well as 1-2 week vacation time. Good "training ground" for county jobs in the future, since Gardner is a county contracted company. Many people leave to go to the county after a few years.
cons: Dont get paid for over time. Medi-cal documentation sucks the joy out of helping people, as you are expected to hold a high case load while meeting short documention deadlines. Many supervisors have minimal clinical experience (less than 5 years) so youre often not knowing how to provide best clinical practices.

review_title: Passionate staff, questionable leadership (GFCC- Mental Health side)
job_title: Mental Health Therapist II in San Jose, CA
pros: Passionate staff. Many different programs. Opportunities to change depts. Diverse staff. Staff reflect the community they serve. Good health benefits and educational money for training. Competitive pay for a county contracted nonprofits.
cons: Just with most other county contracted mental health agencies, there is a huge push for productivity. Gardner has a higher productivity rate than other contacted agencies. Management make decisions without staff input. Building is old.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in San Jose, CA
pros: Co-workers are very professional and knowledgeable, which helps in building stronger teams and improve the quality of work.
cons: The opportunity to take the next step to management is limited, since most of the managers and supervisors have been here for many years.

pros: Very fun place to work. Most if not all coworkers are pleasant to work with.
cons: Workload can be high and stressful at times. But the satisfaction of helping people make it all worth it.

review_title: Like family! But lots of admin work
job_title: Mental Health Therapist in San Jose, CA
pros: Family, fun, decent pay, opportunity, flexibility
Friendly Staff, Lots of hands on experience with kids; meds, breathing treatments, catheters, assist with circumcisions.. Ok benefits, ok pay for non profit, 1 hr lunch

review_title: Good for any mom who wants a 8-5 job
job_title: R N in San Jose, CA
pros: Benefits are great, family like atmosphere, good for people wanting to work 8/5 job.
cons: Pay is below average due to the fact that its an Non profit.

review_title: Lack of leadership, infrastructure, strategy and vision
pros: The mission to support and serve the underserved.
cons: Poorn compensation, lack of structure and infrastructure, old work force, lacking organizational vision

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in San Jose, CA
pros:
Great co worker support
friendly culture
trainings
educational compensation (trainings and books)
cons: Transferring client can be challenging due to waitlist and lack of openings

pros: flexible hours, pleasant coworkers and clinic manager.
cons: poor EHR. Heavy caseload. Difficult but rewarding MediCaid/MediCal patients, 50% Spanish-speaking; MA's interpret.
